item.title: 1 Chronicles 1
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 1

1Adam Avi-Seth Avi-Enosh Avi-2Kenan Avi-Mahalalel Avi-Jared Avi-3Enoch Avi-Methuselah Avi-Lamech Avi-4Noah Avi-Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

5The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, Tiras

6The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Diphath, Togarmah;

7the sons of Javan: Elisha, Tarshish, Kittim, Rodanim;

8The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, Canaan

9The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, Sabteca. The sons of Raamah were Sheba, Dedan;

item.title: 1 Chronicles 2
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 2

1The sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun, 2Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher

3The sons of JUDAH: Er, Onan, and Shelah by Bath-shua the Canaanitess Er, Judah’s firstborn, was sinful; so Yahveh took his life.

4Tamar Judah’s daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.

5The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.

6The sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five. (7The son of Carmi was Achar, the troubler of Israel, who violated the ban.)

item.title: 1 Chronicles 3
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 3

1These were David’s six sons born in Hebron: the firstborn was Ammon by Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second was Daniel by Abigail the Carmelitess;

2the third was Absalom Ben-Maacah Bat-Talmai, king of Geshur; the fourth was Adonijah Ben-Haggith;

3the fifth was Shephatiah by Abital; the sixth was Ithream by his wife Eglah.

4He ruled in Hebron

for 7

½ years and in Jerusalem for 33.

5These were born in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon—four by Bath-shua Bat-Ammiel; 6and Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet, 7Nogah, Nepheg, and Japhia, 8Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet—nine. 9All of those were sons of David besides the sons of concubines. Tamar was their sister.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 4
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 4

1The sons of JUDAH: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal

2Reaiah Ben-Shobal was father of Jahath Avi-Ahumai and Lahad. These were the families of the Zorathites.

3These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash; their sister was Hazzelelponi.

4Penuel was father of Gedor and Ezer Avi-Hushah. Those were the sons of Hur firstborn of Ephrathah ancestor of Bethlehem.

5Ashhur father of Tekoa had two wives: Helah and Naarah. 6Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. 7The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, Ethnan,

item.title: 1 Chronicles 5
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 5

, 3The sons of REUBEN the firstborn of Israel: 3Hanoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi (Because he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph Ben-Israel; so he’s not enrolled in the genealogy by birthright. 2Although Judah prevailed over his brothers and the leader came from him, the birthright was Joseph’s.)

4The sons of Joel were Shemaiah, Gog, Shimei, 5Micah, Reaiah, Baal, 6Beerah that Tilgath-pilneser, king of Assyria, took away into exile. He was leader in Reuben. 7His relatives by clans—when their genealogy was figured—were Jeiel the chief, then Zechariah, 8Bela Ben-Azaz Ben-Shema Ben-Joel that lived in Aroer as far as Nebo and Baal-meon. 9He lived to the east as far as the entrance to the desert this side of the River Euphrates because their livestock had multiplied in Gilead. 10At the time of Saul, they conquered the Hagrites and occupied their tents in the whole region east of Gilead.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 6
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 6

1The descendants of LEVI: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari

2The descendants of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

3The children of Amram were Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

4Eleazar was father of Phinehas Avi-5Abishua Avi-Bukki Avi-6Uzzi Avi-Zerahiah Avi-7Meraioth Avi-Amariah Avi-8Ahitub Avi-Zadok Avi-9Ahimaaz Avi-Azariah Avi-10Johanan Avi-Azariah (priest in the Temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem), and 11Azariah was father of Amariah Avi-12Ahitub Avi-Zadok Avi-13Shallum Avi-Hilkiah Avi-14Azariah Avi-Seraiah Avi-15Jehozadak, who went into exile when Yahveh took Judah and Jerusalem away by Nebuchadnezzar.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 7
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 7

1ISSACHAR had four sons: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.

2The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Samuel, heads of families. Tola’s sons were trained soldiers in their generations. At the time of David they num

bered 22

,600.

3The son of Uzzi was Izrahiah. The sons of Izrahiah were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, Isshiah—all five, mighty men.

4With them by their generations according to their families

item.title: 1 Chronicles 8
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 8

1BENJAMIN was father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel second, Aharah third, 2Nohah fourth, and Rapha fifth.

3Bela was father of Addar, Gera, Abihud, 4Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah, 5Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.

6These are the sons of Ehud, heads of families among the people in Geba. They were exiled to Manahath: 7Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera Avi-Uzza and Ahihud.

8Shaharaim was the father of children in Moab after he’d sent away his wives Hushim and Baara. 9By his wife Hodesh he became father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, 10Jeuz, Sachia, Mirmah, sons and heads of families. 11By Hushim he’d become father of Abitub and Elpaal.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 9
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 9

1So Israel was enrolled by genealogies. They’re recorded in The Book of the Kings of Israel. Judah was exiled to Babylon because they were unfaithful.

2The first to live again in their towns were Israel, the priests, the Levites, and the Temple servants. 3Some descendants of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh lived in Jerusalem:

4from the descendants of Perez Ben-Judah was Uthai Ben-Ammihud Ben-Omri Ben-Imri Ben-Bani;

item.title: 1 Chronicles 10
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 10

1The Philistines attacked Israel, and they fled and fell dead on Mount Gilboa. 2The Philistines overtook Saul and his sons and struck down his sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchi-shua. 3The battle grew intense against Saul, and the archers wounded him. 4He told his armor bearer, “Draw your sword and thrust me through so these uncircumcised Philistines don’t come and torture me.” But his armor bearer was too afraid to do it; so Saul took his sword and fell on it. 5When his armor bearer saw he was dead, he fell on his sword too. 6So Saul’s whole dynasty died together.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 11
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 11

1Then Israel gathered to David in Hebron, “We’re your flesh and bone. 2When Saul was king, you led out and brought in Israel. Yahveh your God said you would shepherd his people and be their leader.”

3The elders in Israel came to him, and he made a treaty with them in Yahveh’s presence. They anointed him king according to Yahveh’s message through Samuel.

4Then David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (Jebus). The Jebusites, natives in the land, lived there. 5They told David, “You won’t get in here”; but he captured the fortress of Zion (The City of David). 6He had said, “Whoever strikes down the Jebusites first will be general of the army.” Joab Ben-Zeruiah went up first, so he became the general. 7David lived in the fortress; so they called it The City of David. 8He built the city all around from the Millo to the surrounding area, and Joab repaired the rest of Jerusalem. 9David became greater and greater because Yahveh was with him.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 12
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 12

1These are men that came over to David at Ziklag, while he still couldn’t move around freely because of Saul. They were among the elite soldiers that helped him during war. 2They used bows. With either hand they could sling stones and shoot arrows. They were Saul’s relatives from Benjamin. 3The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet, sons of Azmaveth; Beracah and Jehu the Anathothite; 4Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, an elite soldier among

item.title: 1 Chronicles 13
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 13

1Then David consulted with every commander of thousands and hundreds, 2and told the whole assembly, “If it seems good to you and if Yahveh our God wills, let’s send around to our relatives that are still in Israel, as well as to the priests and Levites that are with them in their towns and pastures, to have them meet with us. 3Let’s bring the Ark back. We neglected it in Saul’s time.”

item.title: 1 Chronicles 14
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 14

1Hiram, king of Tyre, sent ambassadors to David with cedar trees, masons, and carpenters, to build him a palace. 2David saw that Yahveh had made him secure as king over Israel, and that his kingdom was highly regarded for Israel’s sake. 3He took more wives at Jerusalem and had more sons and daughters. 4His children born in Jerusalem were Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, 5Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet, 6Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia, 7Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 15
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 15

1David built houses for himself in The City of David and prepared a place for the Ark of God and pitched a tent for it. 2He said, “Don’t anybody carry the Ark but Levites. Yahveh chose them to carry it and serve him permanently.” 3He gathered Israel to Jerusalem to bring the Ark up to the place he’d prepared. 4He gathered the sons of Aaron and the Levites:

item.title: 1 Chronicles 16
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 16

1They put the Ark in the tent David had pitched for it and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings to God. 2When David had finished offering them, he blessed the people in Yahveh’s name. 3To every man and woman in Israel, he passed out a loaf of bread, a helping of meat, and a raisin cake.

4He appointed some Levites to serve at the Ark—to celebrate, thank, and praise Yahveh God of Israel: 5Asaph the chief, second to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel with musical instruments—harps and lyres. Asaph played the loud cymbals; 6Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests blew bugles constantly in front of the Ark.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 17
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 17

1While David was living in his palace, he told Nathan the prophet, “I’m living in a cedar palace, but Yahveh’s Ark is under curtains.”

2Nathan said, “Do what’s in your mind. God is with you.”

3That same night, the message from God came to him, 4“Go tell my servant David, ‘Yahveh says, “You’re not to build me a temple. 5I haven’t lived in a temple since I brought Israel up. I’ve gone from tent to tent and place to place. 6In all the places where I’ve lived with Israel, have I asked any judge that I’ve commanded to shepherd my people why he hasn’t built me a cedar temple?”’ 7Tell David, ‘Yahveh of hosts says, “I took you out of the pasture from behind sheep and made you a leader over Israel. 8I’ve been with you wherever you’ve gone and removed your enemies from you. I’ll make you as famous as anyone that’s ever lived in the world. 9I’ll appoint you a place for my people, and plant them so they won’t have to move anymore. Sinful people won’t lay waste to them like they did before, 10including the time I put judges over them. I’ll subdue your enemies and build you a dynasty. 11When your life’s over and you’ve gone to your ancestors, I’ll set up one of your sons and secure his throne permanently. 12He’ll build me a temple. 13I’ll be his father, and he’ll be my son. I won’t take my enduring love away from him like I did with your predecessor. 14I’ll settle him in my house and kingdom permanently.”’”

item.title: 1 Chronicles 18
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 18

1After that, David defeated the Philistines and took Gath and its surrounding towns. 2He defeated Moab and they brought tribute. 3He defeated Hadadezer, king of Zobah, as far as Hamath and secured his rule all the way to the Euphrates River. 4He

took 1

,000 chariots, 7,000 cavalry, and 20,000 foot soldiers. He hamstrung the chariot horses but reserved enough for 100 chariots.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 19
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 19

1After this, Nahash, king of the Ammonites, died and his son became king. 2David said, “I’ll be kind to Hanun because his father was kind to me.” He sent ambassadors to console him about his father. 3But the officials in Ammon told Hanun, “Do you think David is honoring your father by sending ambassadors to comfort you? Haven’t they come to spy out the land to overthrow it?” Hanun took David’s ambassadors and shaved them, cut off their clothes in the middle as high as their hips, and sent them away. 5Some people came and told David about the men. He sent to meet them because they were greatly humiliated. He told them to stay in Jericho till their beards grew back; then come home.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 20
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 20

1In the spring, when kings go to war, Joab led out the army and ravaged the country of the Ammonites and laid siege to Rabbah. David stayed in Jerusalem. Joab attacked Rabbah and overthrew it. 2Then David went to Rabbah and took the crown off their king’s head, and found that it we

ighed 75

½ lbs a talent of gold, and was set with precious stones. They placed it on David’s head, and he brought out a really large amount of spoil from the city. 3He brought the people out, and cut them with saws, sharp instruments, and axes. He did that to all the Ammonite towns. Then he and the people came back to Jerusalem.

4About this time, war broke out with the Philistines at Gezer. Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, a descendant of the giants, and they were subdued. 5There was war with the Philistines again, and Elhanan Ben-Jair killed Lahmi brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam. 6Another time there was war at Gath, where there was a huge man with six digits on each hand and foot. He had descended from the giants too. 7When he taunted Israel, Jonathan, son of David’s brother Shimea, killed him. 8Those three descended from the giants in Gath that David and his warriors killed.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 21
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 21

1Satan stood up against Israel and tempted David to take a census. 2David told Joab and the commanders of the troops, “Go count Israel from Dan to Beersheba and bring me the results so I can know how many there are.”

2David issued an order to gather the foreigners in Israel and set stonecutters to dress stones for God’s Temple. 3He provided large stores of iron for making nails for the doors in the gates and for clamps, more bronze than could be weighed, 4and cedar logs without number. The Sidonians and Tyrians brought him large supplies of cedar timber. 5He said, “My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and Yahveh’s Temple will be magnificent, famous, and glorious all over the world. I’ll stockpile materials for it.” David gathered lots of material for it before he died.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 23
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 23

1When David got old, he appointed Solomon king over Israel. 2He gathered the leaders with the priests and Levites. 3The Le

vites 30

years old and up numbered 38,000. 4Of these, 24,000 oversaw the work, 6,000 were officers and judges, 54,000 were gatekeepers, and 4,000 praised Yahveh with instruments David made for that purpose. 6He divided them according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. 1 Ch 23:1-6

7The sons of Gershon were Ladan and Shimei.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 24
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 24

1These were the divisions of Aaron’s descendants. His sons were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar. 2But Nadab and Abihu died before their father did, and they didn’t have any sons; so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests. 3David—with Zadok from Eleazar’s descendants and Ahimelech from Ithamar’s descendants—divided them by their offices for their service. 4Since there were more chief men descended from Eleazar than from Ithamar, they divided them into 16 heads descended from Eleazar

item.title: 1 Chronicles 25
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 25

1David and the commanders of the army set apart some sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun to prophesy with lyres, harps, and cymbals. Those who performed their service were as follows:

2from the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asharelah were under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied under the direction of the king;

3from the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah—6 were under the direction of their father Jeduthun with the harp, who prophesied by giving thanks and praising Yahveh;

item.title: 1 Chronicles 26
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 26

1For the divisions of the gatekeepers, from the Korahites there was Meshelemiah Ben-Kore from the sons of Asaph. 2Meshelemiah/Shelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael second, Zebadiah third, Jathniel fourth, 3Elam fifth, Johanan sixth, Eliehoenai seventh.

4Obed-edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad second, Joah third, Sacar fourth, Nethanel fifth, 5Ammiel sixth, Issachar seventh, and Peullethai eighth. God had blessed him. 6Shemaiah had sons who governed their family because they were brave soldiers. 7Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers Elihu and Semachiah were brave men. 8Obed-edom’s sons, their sons and relatives were capable and strong for the service—62.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 27
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 27

1These were heads of families, commanders of thousands and hundreds, and their officers that served the king in regard to the divisions that came in and went out month by month all year. Each division num

bered 24

,000.

2Jashobeam Ben-Zabdiel was responsible for the first division for the first month. 3He descended from Perez and was chief of the commanders of the army for the first month.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 28
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 28

1David gathered to Jerusalem the officials in Israel, the leaders of the tribes, the commanders of the divisions that served the king, the commanders over thousands and hundreds, the overseers of the property and livestock that belong to the king and his sons, the officials and elite soldiers, all the brave warriors. 2He stood up and said, “My relatives, my people. I intended to build a permanent temple for the Ark of the Covenant and for a footstool of our God; so I made preparations. 3But he told me, ‘You won’t build me a temple; you’re a soldier that’s shed blood.’ 4But Yahveh chose me from my father’s family to rule Israel permanently. He chose Judah to lead, chose my father’s family in Judah, and delighted in me among my brothers. 5From my sons he’s chosen Solomon to sit on the throne. (Yahveh has given me many sons.) 6He told me, ‘Solomon will build my temple and courts. I’ve chosen him to be my son, and I’ll be his father. 7I’ll make his kingdom permanently secure if he’s resolute in keeping my commandments and ordinances, like he is today.’ 8In front of Israel, in the assembly of Yahveh, and in the hearing of our God, endeavor to follow all his commandments so you can keep the good land and leave it for your descendants. David’s Charge to Solomon 9“Solomon, son, know your father’s God. Serve him with all your heart and a willing mind, because Yahveh examines every heart and understands every intent. 10Be diligent about that because he has chosen you to build a temple for the sanctuary. Have the courage to do it.”

item.title: 1 Chronicles 29
item.description:
1 Chronicles Chapter 29

1David told the assembly, “God alone has chosen Solomon. He’s young and new to the work. It’s an important undertaking; the Temple won’t be for some mortal but for Yahveh God. 2I’ve provided as much material as I could: gold, silver, bronze, iron, and wood—plus large amounts of onyx, gems for settings, antimony, colored stones, marble—all kinds of precious stones. 3In addition, I’m giving my own gold and silver: 4113¼ tons 3,000 talents of gold from Ophir, 264¼ tons 7,000 talents of refined silver for overlaying the walls of the Temple, 5and the gold and silver items the craftsmen will make. Who will offer willingly, consecrating himself to Yahveh today?”
